answerText: Phenol [or phenyl alcohol or carbolic acid][10] This normal aromatic hydrocarbon is used as a solvent, usually in paint or ink thinners, and also acts as an octane booster in gasoline. It contains of a methyl group attached to benzene, and an explosive tri nitro derivative.
heading: ACF Fall |2008 | Caltech + Langston | 6 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Everybody loves Benzene, but can you name some derivates of benzene? Find out.  [10] The Hooker process built upon the Raschig process to produce this compound, which consists of a hydroxyl group attached to benzene.
